data.title: New build homes London – Newham
data.meta_description: Brand new homes in Newham launching soon. To learn more about pricing and how you can be the first to view these amazing homes visit our website.
data.text:
Eat and drink like a local from an eclectic mixture of bars, cafés and restaurants.

West Ham Village's Central Square will see lively seasonal markets and street food vendors that excite the senses, whilst residents can soak up the sun with some al fresco dining at the Cordova Building.

A short walk away you've the likes of Starlane Pizza Bar which is also used as a music venue, recording studio and workspace.

yapix, in nearby Canning Town, is an artisanal café and wine bar serving coffee, sustainably sourced wine and cocktails.

With 12 acres of open green space being established as part of the regeneration, West Ham Village promises to be a calming oasis in the heart of the city.

Just a short train ride away, there's top-class sports facilities at The Olympic Park including the London Aquatics Centre and an impressive gym at the Copper Box Arena.

East London Rugby Football Club based at West Hams's memorial Park welcomes players regardless of background, and equally encourage supporters at their home games!

Pursuing your interests or creating new ones has never been easier.

Budding artists can develop their skills at Rosetta Arts through its ongoing range of projects and classes.

Cody-Dock next to the Lower Lea River plays host to food festivals, summer art exhibitions and workshops. Wander through the lush gardens or meet friends for a riverside rendevous at a café or bar.

Just 2-minutes on the Jubilee line and you're at Westfield in Stratford, home to over 300 brands from fashion to sport, as well as a range of restaurants and a 20-screen cinema.

And let's not forget the O2 Arena in North Greenwich where you can see some of the world's biggest performers.

Shared Ownership is a part buy/part rent scheme, designed as a stepping stone for first time buyers looking to get onto the property ladder.

You can buy an initial share of 25% to 75% of the value of a property, which you can pay for with a mortgage.

You will then pay a subsidised rent on the share you don’t buy and a monthly service charge.

A GUIDE TO SHARED OWNERSHIP
